title: Palazodeen
author: Palazodeen
content: Understanding BRC-20 BRC-20, often referred to as a "Web3 native" token standard, is a groundbreaking innovation that operates on the Bitcoin blockchain. It was introduced in March 2023 and has quickly gained attention within the cryptocurrency community. BRC-20 is built on the principles of the ordinals protocol, a novel approach to token creation and management. Since its introduction to the crypto space, BRC-20 tokens has taken centre stage with over 14,706 tokens minted and a market cap above $1billion.  Understanding ERC-20  ERC-20,is a standard for fungible tokens on the Ethereum blockchain. It defines a set of rules and functions that tokens must follow to be considered ERC-20 compliant. ERC-20 tokens have played a crucial role in the development of decentralized finance (Defi) boosting of over $230billion mcap. BRC-20 vs ERC-20 Let's now dive into the comparison between BRC-20 and ERC-20, exploring their differences, use cases, and future prospects. Origin and Blockchain Ecosystem BRC-20: BRC-20 tokens operate on the Bitcoin Blockchain, which has a well-established reputation as the pioneer blockchain, and is set to continue this rise in time to come with support from top industry player like Bitget always showing up earlier to expose the tokens to a wider community. ERC-20: ERC-20 tokens, on the other hand, are based on the Ethereum blockchain, one of the early entrants into the blockchain industry. Ethereum's smart contract capabilities and extensive developer community have established ERC-20 as the dominant standard for token creation. Transaction Fees and Scalability BRC-20: BRC-20 tokens operate on the Bitcoin blockchain, which has faced some criticism regarding transaction fees. The design of ordinal inscriptions contributes to these fees, which can make BRC-20 transactions relatively more expensive compared to other blockchains.  ERC-20: Transaction fees on the Ethereum network have also been a topic of concern, particularly during periods of high network congestion. Ethereum's scalability challenges have led to slower transaction processing times and higher fees during peak periods, leading many Web3 users to resort to scalability solutions, such as Layer 2s. Closing While there have been heavy cash flow of money into the BRC-20 token ecosystem lately with tokens like $ORDI, $SATS and $RATS amongst others doing really well, It is important to note that both BRC-20 and ERC-20 have their unique strengths and applications, although there is a growing speculation that BRC-20 will take over the reign from ERC-20 in the nearest future. Do you share the same sentiment? Lets discuss.  Source: https://docs.google.com/document/u/0/d/1G5lPajOMnY2ozWzDfHHjyyKNggaiFLkPq17eoi26aWE/mobilebasic
